decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - This proposal CONSTITUTES DEVELOPMENT within the meaning of Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, and a planning application IS REQUIRED. 

This is because the proposed outbuilding is not considered to be of a purpose incidental to the existing dwellinghouse and therefore falls outside the scope of Class E Part 1 Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Develpent) Order 2015 (as amended)

Reason : 2 - Had the use been considered incidental, officer would consider that the proposal CONSTITUTES DEVELOMENT within the meaning of Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 and a planning application IS REQUIRED.  

The proposed outbuilding given its combined scale, absence of justification to demonstrate why it was not possible to accommodate the activities in the enlarged dwelling and lack of satisfactory demonstration that the outbuilding is reasonably required for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the main dwellinghouse fails to demonstrate compliance with Schedule 2, Part 1, Class E of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, as amended.
description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE ERECTION OF A PROPOSED SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING IN THE REAR GARDEN FOR USE INCIDENTAL TO THE ENJOYMENT OF THE DWELLINGHOUSE.
